intro: Satureja crassinervis, commonly known as broad-veined savory, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Satureja crassinervis is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its aromatic, slightly peppery scent.
